file_content.text: Now they've got me waiting on redeployment orders, can you believe it?
Haha! That was great! I could see those strikes come down from here!
After that display, I'm going to recommend the final model be named in your honor.
I'd like to hang onto this targeter for a while.
It'll serve me well.
Addictive, isn't it? I'm afraid the prototype wasn't intended for sustained use.
You're too kind.
We'll be collecting the Delta-A5 soon to make adjustments based on the data you provided.
I couldn't care less.
Right, I've taken up enough of your time.
Here's a little something on behalf of the project. It's been a pleasure.
Careful where you point that designator, you don't want to be too close.
Wow, you all look like you're ready to cause some damage. Here, get a load of this.
Wow, I bet you don't need a cannon to flatten a bunker. Still, this might interest you.
Now that is some serious ordnance you're packing there. You'll get a kick out of this.
Oh, sir, you'd be perfect for this. Need a little infiltration sabotage, with a dash of target spotting.
Wow, I bet you're the type who appreciates a good explosion.
Navy just deployed the next-generation prototype of our top orbital strike weapon. She's a real beauty, let me tell you.
I'm supposed to be overseeing test firing against hard targets in the area, but we're on indefinite standby until conditions improve.
Tatooine hardly seems like the best place to be doing this.
Odd testing ground.
It's so out of the way, it's just about perfect. But our targets are more well protected than we anticipated.
What conditions?
Why waste my time about it?
The Exchange is seriously entrenched out here, but they're protecting their strongholds with a wide-area signal jammer.
It means our targeting systems are useless, even the handheld, close-up targeters.
You want this jammer taken out of the picture.
I see where this is going.
You got it in one.
Why hasn't your commander taken care of this?
This is a job for troops.
No manpower. We've requested support, but Command's dragging their feet. Could be weeks. I'd like to see my girl in action sooner rather than later.
Sounds like you'd have to get close to your targets either way.
Handheld targeters?
Yeah, not a problem for you, though, right?
Once that jammer is out of commission, we can blow up anything we want, anytime we want.
You with me on this? You could be the first to debut this beauty's ten kiloton wrath.
It's only fitting that I have this honor.
I like the way you think.
What a delightful suggestion.
I like the way you think.
You're honoring the entire project with your support, my lord.
I wouldn't mind brushing up on my crater making.
I like the way you think.
Ha! I knew you couldn't resist this kind of firepower.
You could say I'm familiar with the technology. I'd love to test drive the latest model.
I like the way you think.
And they say Intelligence never does anything for the common soldier.
How can I do that?
Let's just get this over with.
The Exchange leaders are the only ones with access to the jammer; their security spikes would let you shut it down.
With the jammer out of commission, you can use this targeter to blow any Exchange assets in the area sky-high.
Hit anything you can get in range of, bigger the better, just don't stand too close. I'll look forward to the light show.
Oh, what I wouldn't give for a TX24 and some high-explosive shells right now.
